page.title: 16Yaxham Church
page.content: This round towered church was built over 1000 years ago.The tower is built up with bands of flint,carrstone and conglomerate stones;this is a Saxon feature.The south porch entrance was added in about 1390.Above the south aisle is a sundial,a copy of which is on the village sign,which also shows the church.Inside the church at the entrance to the belfry is an opening in the wall,about 7 metres from the ground.Many years ago the only way into the tower was by using a rope ladder which could be pulled up through the opening.This was done many years ago when the country was invaded and the church as a fortress.There used to be five bells;the oldest was made by a John Draper of Norwich in 1625.
